intro: Dicoria canescens var. brandegeei, commonly known as the Brandegee's dicoria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
